content.raw:
Ok, so when I change the color of a preceding link (that doesn't have geometry in the current version of the model) [here](https://github.com/tu-darmstadt-ros-pkg/hector_models/blob/fa587d4569ff720ca1cbd124b0784fb139f1bbc7/hector_components_description/urdf/spinning_lidar_mount.urdf.xacro#L80), the LIDAR also inherits that color. It thus seems like child links inherit the material properties of their parent links (which they should not IMHO, at least not when having material properties defined).

After removing the gazebo material tags ([changeset](https://github.com/tu-darmstadt-ros-pkg/hector_models/commit/c4acd902e086fbf731250cc32206336edaa661ba)) for the parent links, the .dae visualization looks correct.
